# NZ-XXXX: Specification Title
Version: draft v0  
Status: Active  
Category: <Core/Protocol/Model/Structure/Other>  

## 1. Purpose
Describe the purpose of the specification.  
Explain what problem it solves and why it exists.

## 2. Scope
Define the boundaries of the specification.  
List what is included and what is explicitly excluded.

## 3. Terminology
Define all key terms used in the document.  
Ensure deterministic and unambiguous definitions.

## 4. Principles
List the core principles guiding this specification.  
These must align with NZ-0001 (minimalism, autonomy, durability, etc.).

## 5. Design Constraints
Define strict limitations and rules that shape the specification.  
Avoid implementation details.

## 6. Specification
Provide the formal, deterministic description of the component.  
Use clear structure, lists, and subsections as needed.  
Avoid subjective language and ambiguity.

## 7. Security Considerations
Describe security assumptions, guarantees, and potential risks.  
Ensure alignment with “Security by Design” from NZ-0001.

## 8. Future Work
List planned extensions, improvements, or related specifications.

## 9. References
List external references if necessary.  
If none, write:
